author: Special Correspondent
text:
The police team investigating the murder of Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) worker P.V. Sujith on February 15 said it has intensified the probe.

Police identified the six Communist Party of India (Marxist) workers who were arrested late on Wednesday as Sreejayan, Joy Joseph, Prabesh B., Lipin, Akash, and M. Prasanth. All of them are from Aroli and Keecheri, near Pappinissery. The police said that the 14 other identified accused were absconding.

A special police team led by Valapattanam Circle Inspector T.P. Sreejith is investigating the case.

The investigators are carrying out the probe on the basis of their preliminary finding that the murder was instigated by political rivalry.

Sujith had succumbed to fatal injuries he had suffered when the assailants attacked him at his house late night on February 15 in front of his parents and brother.
title: 14 accused in Sujith murder case ‘absconding’
